title: Started studying Computer Science at the University of East Anglia
description: After discovering my passion for programming, I set my sights on software development for my future and decided to study computer science at the University of East Anglia.

title: Web Developer Internship at Robot Mascot
description: During my 2nd year at UEA, I was interviewed and accepted as a full stack web developer intern at Robot Mascot where I worked together with a team to build an bespoke e-commerce website for a client.

title: UEA App Development Internship
description: In the summer of my 2nd year at UEA, I successfully applied for an internship hosted by the university where I worked in a team with other interns to develop a mobile application for a client using the Scrum/Agile framework. Developed with Unity, C#, Firebase.

title: Freelance Web Developer
description: After the web developer internship, I was hired as a freelance web developer to maintain and add new features/functionality to the bespoke e-commerce website that was developed and launched during the internship.

title: Associate Tutor
description: In my final year, I was asked to be take on the role of an associate tutor and be a lab assistant for a 2nd year computer science module for that semester. I would provide software engineering and Java assistance to students that required it in computer labs for a 2nd year module while in my 3rd year of studies. Successfully troubleshooting code with short familiarisation with code.

title: Graduated from University of East Anglia
description: Graduated with a First Class Honours in Computer Science (BSc) at the University of East Anglia. I achieved 79% overall average and 85.5% in my final year project (dissertation). During this course, I studied graphics, computer vision, networking, parallel computation, and more.  I was awarded best individual performance.
